title: Civil War Educational Resources: National Portrait Gallery
description: Lesson plans introduce history through portraiture--specifically, the wartime Abraham Lincoln as seen in photographs, engravings, and a "life mask." A lesson on Lincoln and Walt Whitman brings poetry and music into the mix.

title: Art to Zoo: Turning Dreams into Reality (1984-85)
description: The issue takes students on a guided tour of the invention process, from dreams to the reality. It includes a  pull-out page¬ù detailing the early history of the photograph.

title: Archives Alive!: Learning from Landscapes Past, Cultivating Garden Memories for the Future
description: Interpretive and educational package of resources. Students learn about the importance of nature, landscapes, and environment in their everyday lives, and use an expanded notion of ''literacy'' that encourages collaborative and critical thinking, writing, reading and observation.

title: Art to Zoo: Talking Houses_What They Can Tell You about the People They Shelter (1987)
description: In this issue, students look closely at houses from other cultures and find intriguing clues about the people who built them. In a lesson, they use an inquiry approach to draw conclusions about tipis.

title: Designing a Playground!
description: Unit of teacher-created lessons in which students use math, science, language arts, and life skills in the process of designing a safe, fun playground.

title: Black Holes _ Space Warps and Time Twists
description: Companion website to the Black Holes traveling exhibit. Includes exhibit walkthrough, educational resources, multimedia, black hole primer, live Gamma-Ray burst map, printable activities, interactive games, and much more.

title: On the Go! Forces and Motion
description: Unit of teacher-created lessons in which students investigate types of motion--and the motions of various geometric shapes--as they design a car that goes far and fast.

title: Art to Zoo: Stories from the Deep (1977)
description: This magazine-format issue of Art to Zoo includes ideas for teaching about mollusks, a brief history of the Smithsonian, and tips for gathering historical information from gravestones.

title: Let Your Motto Be Resistance: African American Portraits
description: Lesson plan has students study portraits of famous African Americans in history, explain the social and political impact of each portrait sitter, and discuss what it means to take a stand. Targets grades 3-6.
